items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message: River levels remain high on the Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water due to prolonged rainfall over the weekend. Areas most at risk include the Upper Derwent from Seathwaite to Derwent Water. The risk of flooding remains possible in this area today 17/07/2023, to low lying land, roads and footpaths. The lake level is expected to remain high, and the risk of flooding to low-lying land remains. We will continue to monitor levels closely. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 09:30 AM on 18/07/2023, or as the situation changes. Follow @EnvAgencyNW on Twitter for information for your area.

River and lake levels on the River Greta, River Derwent, Derwent Water lake remain high following prolonged rainfall. Areas most at risk include low lying areas bordering the shores of Derwent Water and the frontage of the Keswick Camping and Caravan Club Site. The risk of flooding remains and may affect low lying areas today 17/07/2023. Some further showers are forecast throughout the day but largely dry until Tuesday 18/07/23. The level of Derwent Water is still expected to begin to fall slowly during today 17/07/2023. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 18/07/2023, or as the situation changes. Follow @EnvAgencyNW on Twitter for information for your area.
